body.description: This 6-pack of Evenflo Feeding Balance Plus Stage 2 Pacifiers was expertly designed for babies 6 months and up to self soothe and help support oral development. The orthodontic shape of the Balance + Pacifier is the preferred design for babies who have teeth emerging. Now your baby can self soothe while also providing the support they need while they transition into a new stage of oral development. Made from 100% soft silicone, this pacifier is lightweight, flexible, and features a curved faceplate, making it easier for baby to suck on for longer periods of time. This flexible 1-piece silicone pacifier features an easy-grip handle that makes it easy for mom, dad, aunt, uncle, or baby to hold! Every mom, dad, and babysitter knows that pacifiers can be your best friend — we've designed the Balance Plus Stage 2 Pacifier to help soothe your baby as their teeth start to emerge. We know that you're committed to your child's safety — and so are we! The Balance + Pacifiers are 100% free of polycarbonates, PVC and phthalates, and are also made of food grade silicone. Designed to support oral development for babies 6+ months, the Balance Plus Orthodontic Pacifier is the perfect choice for new, expecting, and experienced parents, and will help your baby self soothe while they grow and develop!

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #18,012 in Baby (See Top 100 in Baby) #375 in Baby Pacifiers

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wish they made them bigger
reviews.reviewText: My 4th baby wouldn't take to the Nuk orthodontic pacifier like all his siblings. We found these and he loved them. I liked the 1 piece design, the soft silicone material, and once I found green, the fact that they were easier to find than the clear ones. Now we have an almost 18 month old and his pacifier is CLEARLY too small. I wish they made these larger as a 6 month old baby's mouth is much smaller than an 18-24 month. These 6+ month ones are about the same size as Nuk 3-6 month and are much too small for the older babies. I have tried every kind I can find that look similar and can't find one that he'll take so I'm very frustrated and worry if he keeps on with these small ones his mouth and teeth won't spread like they're supposed to. Please make larger nipples and give this mama some breathing room before I have to wean him!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars EBF Baby Approved!
reviews.reviewText: These check all the boxes for us- one piece & easy to clean, lightweight and easily stays in baby’s mouth! I love that the handle is easy for baby to hold & works with pacifier clips/loveys as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Picky Binky Baby’s Only Choice
reviews.reviewText: All other pacifiers get spit out. Not sure if it’s relevant to her tongue tie but babe LOVES these. Has used them since birth and pretty much refused every other binky. I don’t suggest the clear cause they’re super easy to lose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Our son loves these! It took him a few days to transition to the newer style, but it really helps with his teething fussiness. They are alright to clean, but the 6 small holes across the top require the tiny straw brush and the wire sometimes gets stuck in the smallest two holes. And since they are almost clear, they are very difficult to find when he drops them. Regardless of these minor things, I would definitely recommend these and buy them again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Baby/Toddler Loves These
reviews.reviewText: We tried a ton of pacifiers with our preemie when he was born. These were the only ones he liked from day one ( in the stage one kind ) and then when it was time we got the stage 2. He should not still have a pacifier, but he's our last and we're weak and he still loves it and will be 2, haha. Love the green ones. We have gone crazy for the first two years with the clear ones. Who invented clear pacifiers?? They're impossible to see! Definitely get the green ones!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stays in baby’s mouth
reviews.reviewText: Stays in baby’s mouth so much better than many pacifiers I’ve tried - has a little curve to it that conforms better. I can hook my finger through the handle to keep hold of the pacifier, yet keep my hand free (which is a necessity for parenting). Easy to clean, matches with everything bc it’s clear. I’ve had 4 babies who have all loved pacifiers, and this one is the absolute best.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Got these as a replacement for the traditional pacifiers we were using previously. They worked well, and I like that they are one continuous piece so they can be effectively washed so mold cannot grow. Would recommend them for a younger child as opposed to an older child. My almost 2 yo has now bitten through two. I don’t personally mind as the goal is to phase them out completely by her birthday anyway, but it’s something to keep in mind if you’re buying for an older child.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Extremely tiny nipple. More like newborn size
reviews.reviewText: These say they are for six months and up. They are extremely small the nipple is more like for a newborn. I found it very disappointing as they are smaller than the ones we are trying to graduate from. These are a great newborn pacifier I will be using them for the next baby. But my seven-month-old is not into them
